html: Jehovah “guards” or defends his elect against Assyria’s assault in a new Passover. The words “by protecting it he will deliver it, by passing over it, preserve it” create word links to other instances of Jehovah’s delivering his people: “I will protect this city and save it, for my own sake and for the sake of my servant David” (Isaiah 37:35); “I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria; I will protect this city” (Isaiah 38:6); “Those whose minds are steadfast, [O Jehovah,] you preserve in perfect peace, for in you they are secure” (Isaiah 26:3; cf. 1:8; 41:11-12; 51:22-23; 54:15-17).
